samples.context: Striated muscles, also known as skeletal muscles, have a banded appearance due to the arrangement of actin and myosin filaments. These muscles are primarily attached to bones and facilitate voluntary movements. Unstriated muscles, or smooth muscles, lack this striation and are found in internal organs like the stomach and blood vessels, functioning involuntarily. Cardiac muscle, found exclusively in the heart, has a striated appearance but works involuntarily, with intercalated discs allowing synchronized contractions.
